lines.content: * Represents a Deadline task which has a description and a due date/time.
* This class extends Task and adds deadline-specific information
* Constructs a Deadline task from the description and deadline string.
* Parses the deadline string to LocalDateTime
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param deadline Deadline string in the format "d/M/yyyy HHmm"
* Constructs a Deadline task from the description and LocalDateTime deadline.
* @param description Description of the deadline task
* @param deadline Deadline as a LocalDateTime object
* Represents an Event task that has a description, a start time and an end time.
* Extends the base Task class and add event-specific details.
* Constructs an Event task from description and start and end time strings.
* Parses start and end times to LocalDateTime objects.
* @param from Start time as a string with format "d/M/yyyy HHmm"
* @param to End time as a string with format "d/M/yyyy HHmm"
public Event(String desc, String from, String to) {
* Constructs an Event task from description and start and end time as LocalDateTime objects.
* @param from Start time as a LocalDateTime object
* @param to End time as a LocalDateTime object

* Main controller class for the Olaf application.
* Manages main program loop, user input and task management.
* Constructs the Olaf application with the specified file path for storage.
* Load the existing tasks from storage, initialising a new task list if loading fails.
* @param filePath Path to the storage file for tasks.
ui.showError("Failed to load data. Starting with an empty list.");
* Runs the main program loop, reading user commands and executing them until exit command issued.
* The entry point of the Olaf application.
* Parses user input commands and modifies the task list, or call the UI to show the messages accordingly.
* Supports commands to add different types of lists, list tasks, mark/unmark tasks as done, delete tasks,
* Parses the given user input,and react accordingly to the user commands on the provides task list and UI.
* @param input The command entered by the user, trimmed of trailing spaces.
* @param taskList The TaskList object holding the current tasks in the list.
* @param ui The UI object for displaying the messages.
* @return True if command signals program to end, false otherwise.
* @throws OlafException if input command is invalid or in the wrong format.
public static boolean parse (String input, TaskList taskList, Ui ui) throws OlafException {
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! There are no tasks to mark");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! 'mark' requires a valid integer.");

throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! There are no tasks to unmark");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! 'unmark' requires a valid integer.");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! Task number for 'unmark' must be between 1 and " +
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! The description of a todo task cannot be empty.");
//Split details into array of 2, desc and deadline
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline task cannot be empty.");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! The deadline task requires both a description and a deadline.");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! The deadline of a deadline task cannot be empty.");
//Try to parse the given date and time
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! Please enter the date in this format:" +
//split details into corresponding parts using index
"OOPS!!! An event needs both a start time(/from) and an end time(/to).");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! Event description, start or end time cannot be empty.");
//Try to parse given date and time
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! Please enter both 'from' and 'to' in this format: d/M/yyyy HHmm\n" +
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! There are no tasks to delete.");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! 'delete' requires a valid integer");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! Task number for delete must be between 1 and " +
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! There are no tasks to find.");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! The description of a find cannot be empty.");
throw new OlafException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know that command :(.");
* Handles loading and saving of tasks to and from a file.
* Responsible for keeping task data between program runs.
* Constructs a Storage instance with the specified file path.
* @param filepath Path to the file used for saving and loading tasks
* Loads the list of tasks from the file.
* If the file does not exist, an empty list is returned.
* @return The ArrayList of tasks fetched from the file.
//If no such file, return empty task list

* Create directories and files if they do not exist.

* Represents a generic task with description, completion status and a type(TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT)
* Base class for all specific task types
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description and task type.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* This method inherits the base description from {@link Object#toString()}.
* Manages the list of tasks, provides methods to add, list, mark, unmark, and delete tasks.
* Handle saving changes to storage as well.
* Constructs a TaskList with a given list of tasks and a storage object.
* Initialises the count of tasks based on the initial list given.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks.
* @param storage The Storage instance responsible for storing the tasks.
* Adds a new task to the task list, updates count and saves to storage.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
System.out.println("  Understood. I have added this task for you:" );
System.out.println("  You currently have a total of " + this.count + " tasks in your list.");
* Lists out all the tasks that are currently in the task list,
System.out.println("  Here are the tasks you have in your list:");
* Marks a task in the task list at the given position as done, updates it in storage.
* @param pos The 1-based position of the task that is to be marked as done.
System.out.println("  Nicely done! I have marked this task as done:");
* Marks the task in the task list at the given position as not done, updates it in storage.
* @param pos The 1-based position of the tsk that is to be marked as not done
System.out.println("  Alright, I have marked this task as undone:");
* Deletes the task at the given position from the task list, updates count and storage.
* @param pos The 1-based position of the task to be deleted
System.out.println("  Noted. I have removed this task for you:");
System.out.println("  You currently have a total of " + this.count + " tasks in your list.");
* Finds and prints all tasks whose description contains the given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in the tasks
System.out.println("  Here are the matching tasks in your list:");

* Represents a ToDo task which has a description and can be marked done or undone.
* This class extends the base Tasl class with a type TODO.

* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Handles all user interactions, includes input and output.
* Provides methods to show welcome and goodbye messages.
private final Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message when application starts.
System.out.println("  Heyyos! I'm Olaf! Your personal assistant:)");
System.out.println("  What can I do for you in this beautiful day?");
* Displays the goodbye message when the application ends
System.out.println("  Goodbye! Hope to see you again soon!");
